issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Let's document {{dfs.namenode.resource.*}} in hdfs-default.xml and a section the in the HDFS docs that covers local directories.

{{dfs.namenode.resource.check.interval}} - the interval in ms at which the NameNode resource checker runs (default is 5000)

{{dfs.namenode.resource.du.reserved}} - the amount of space to reserve/require for a NN storage directory (default is 100mb)

{{dfs.namenode.resource.checked.volumes}} - a list of local directories for the NN resource checker to check in addition to the local edits directories (default is empty).

{{dfs.namenode.resource.checked.volumes.minimum}} - the minimum number of redundant NN storage volumes required (default is 1). If no redundant resources are available we don't enter SM if there are sufficient required resources.

comments.body: This should also cover the DF interval (3s) and DU interval (10min) since the NN resource checker numbers depend on the DU/DF values.
new patch attached. Can you review?
Marking "patch available" for Daisuke so that test-patch runs.

Hi Daisuke/Mark, the latest patch looks pretty good. A few little comments:

# The description for dfs.namenode.resource.du.reserved should mention what unit the config is in. In particular, it's in bytes.
# Given that the unit of dfs.namenode.resource.du.reserved is bytes, the default value for it should be 104857600.
# I don't understand the description "If no redundant resources are available we don't enter SM if there are sufficient required resources." Could you perhaps rewrite this to be a little more clear?

Hi Aaron, thanks for your review.

About the description "If no redundant resources are available we ......", I have no idea what it means either after checking the source code.
I just remove this line.
